item.title: When Is Honkai: Star Rail Collab Coming To Fortnite? Release Date, Skins & Free ‘Blade’ Outfit
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite loves a good collab. miHoYo and Honkai: Star Rail are joining forces with the Fortnite goliath to create epic content for all players to experience through skins and more, and a release date is available.

Honkai: Star Rail is another HoYoverse success, with the free-to-play title continuing to dominate the scene over two years after its explosion into the universe. Epic Games smells success from a mile away, which is why a Honkai: Star Rail and Fortnite collab makes too much sense NOT to do.

Honkai: Star Rail & Fortnite Collab Release Date

The Fortnite and Honkai: Star Rail collab goes live on February 26.

This isn’t a collab weeks away or months down the pipeline; the official announcement was revealed on February 6. In the same statement, ‘February 26’ was outed, and arrives one week after the now-delayed Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Human Bill Boss Location—Where to Find & All Loot

It’s not an extensive crossover, but fans of both franchises will be pleased with the upcoming content.

You can look forward to “A brand-new UEFN island and kick off a creator-involved collaboration tournament,” to celebrate the occasion.

All Honkai: Star Rail & Fortnite Content & Skins

Kafka and Blade are the headline additions in the Honkai: Star Rail and Fortnite collab, debuting with cool character outfits, and there will also be the usual array of content: Back Bling, Pickaxe, and more.

Here’s everything that’s been revealed so far, along with the expected content arriving:

  • Stellaron Hunter Kafka skin (compatible with LEGO styles).
  • Stellaron Hunter Blade skin (compatible with LEGO styles).
  • Back Bling.
  • Pick Axe.
  • Additional crossover content.
  • Emote (Unconfirmed).
  • Glider (Unconfirmed).

Here’s what’s been said about the crossover so far:

“The collaboration introduces Outfits (compatible with LEGO styles) for Kafka and Blade into the Fortnite Shop, each featuring a distinctive visual design drawn from their in-game identities in Honkai: Star Rail. Players will also be able to obtain a Back Bling, a Pickaxe, and access additional crossover content, including LEGO Styles for use in LEGO Fortnite.”

How To Get Free Blade Character Outfit In Fortnite

You need to download Honkai: Star Rail from the Epic Games Store during the outlined Fortnite collab period, and “participate in designated activities” to receive a free “Blade” character outfit.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite February 2026 Roadmap: Love Legends Event, Collabs & More

The activities have yet to be defined, so you’ll have to hang fire until the collab is out first. The skin itself and the design are also unconfirmed, but if you love Honkai: Star Rail, it will be a must-complete challenge(s).

Are you looking forward to a Honkai and Fortnite collab? What collabs do you hope to see in 2026? Share your suggestions through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out where to find a lock-on Assault Rifle in Fortnite and where to find Bigfoot for more guides and content.

item.title: Amazon Prime Free Games For February 2026 Includes Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands
item.content:encoded:
Amazon has announced its latest collection of free games available for all Amazon Prime members in February.

Available on Amazon Luna, formerly known as Prime Gaming, this month includes 10 games over the course of four weeks to claim. This month’s games include titles like Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands, Ambition: A Minuet in Power, and Total War: Attila.

To claim the games, simply visit the Amazon Luna site and login.

After you claim the games, you’ll be given a code for various storefronts. All you have to do is redeem them in the proper store, and the games are yours to keep forever. It’s important to note that the games are for PC only.

That’s even if you decide to cancel your Amazon Prime Membership.

Below you can find the full list of games you can claim this month from Amazon along with when they’ll be available and the stores the codes are for. Be sure to leave your thoughts on the available games in the comments and over in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

Amazon Prime’s Free Games – February 2026

Available Today

  • Tiny Tina’s Wonderlands – Epic Games Story
  • Dread Templayer – Amazon Games App

February 12

  • Hexguardian – Epic Games Store
  • Around the World: Travel to Brazil Collector’s Edition – Legacy Games

February 19

  • Ambition: A Minuet in Power – GOG
  • Captain Blood – GOG
  • Meganoid – GOG

February 26

  • Rebel Galaxy Outlaw – GOG
  • Total War: Attila – Epic Games Store
  • Tavern Talk – Amazon Games App

Should none of these games tickle your fancy, there are plenty of other games you can claim right now on the service. Some of the games include Civilization 6, Gunslugs: Rogue Tactics, Elderborn, Lego 2K Drive, and Harold Halibut, among others.

There are also hundreds of other games you can play directly in your browser through the Amazon Luna streaming service. Amazon Luna is included with your Amazon Prime membership.

For more news, read about Nvidia reportedly not planning to release new graphics cards in 2026. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2 Delayed by Over Two Weeks
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2 was supposed to arrive on March 4, 2026, but is now arriving on March 19.

Chapter 7 Season 1 of Fortnite introduces a bunch of new content, including a brand new island, new weapons, collaborations with Hollywood, including Back to the Future and Kill Bill, the South Park crossover, and so much more. It seems players will now have to spend some more time with this Season, until Epic Games works on CH7S2.

Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2 Now Arrives on March 19

A new post on X (formerly Twitter) by the official Fortnite Status account confirms that Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2 will now release on March 19, 15 days later than intended. It also includes the caption “opens the loot vault & starts cooking” with a ‘Let Him Build’ version of the Let Him Cook meme. It seems that Fortnite is hinting that they have something special in the works with the upcoming Season, and that’s the reason for the holdup.

Players have a little over a month until the next season begins, and there is a lot to look forward to. The February roadmap reveals details on events, maps, skins, collabs, and more coming throughout the month. Additionally, the game’s director has teased a “fun update” coming in February, which is designed to “spice things up” in the current season.

In other news, Paul Heyman wants players to play WWE 2K26 instead of Call of Duty and Fortnite. Additionally, Fortnite has teased a brand new collaboration with Honkai Star Rail. What are your thoughts on Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2 being delayed by over two weeks? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Embark Studios working on two new games. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
